title: Michael Jackson’s kids host Thriller night for Halloween
text:
Blanket made a rare appearance at Thriller night (Picture: Rex Features)

Michael Jackson’s children united in his name to do some good for charity this weekend, hosting their annual Thriller event in Los Angeles.

Paris and Prince Jackson took over the family estate on Friday night to host a fundraiser in partnership with Heal LA Foundation, a non-profit charity which aims to help families struggling in the Los Angeles area.

Joining him on the red carpet was their younger brother Blanket, now known as Bigi, who tends to live a private life and rarely makes public appearances. Michael’s nephews Taryll, TJ and Taj Jackson also stopped by the bash but it would have been hard to spot them as they were dressed in frightful Halloween costumes.

Prince, 22, recalled fond memories of their childhood where Michael, who died in 2009, would allow them to do fancy dress together on Halloween.

‘A lot of people know that my dad liked to have our faces covered to protect our identity and as the most famous man in the world, it [was] very hard for him to get out and do normal things,’ he recalled to the Associated Press at the party.

‘But because it’s acceptable in Halloween to dress up in full costume, that was one of the only times when we could hang out outside as a family.’

Prince continued: ‘We would always dress up as superheroes and the one I always remember was Spider-Man, It would be very simple, one piece, velcro on the back and a pull over mask. I always remember the smell of my own saliva in there, it was kind of nasty.

Prince took over the Jackson estate to host the event (Picture: Rex Features)

Prince was joined by his cousins Taj and TJ (Picture: Getty Images)

Prince opted not to get into costume this year (Picture: Getty Images)

‘It was always fun because no one knows who you were and you could grab candy, it’s a really fun experience.’

TJ also said: ‘It’s funny though because he would do that [dress up in costume] but he has such a unique walk that you could tell it was someone different… but for us, watching him walk, it was such a Michael Jackson walk but no one knows.’

While Taj added: ‘Or he would be in his loafers and white socks. He’d be dressed up but his shoes would give him away.’

Following the event, Paris, 21, shared a heartfelt message praising her older brother for taking the reigns and organising the charity night.

In an Instagram post, she wrote: ‘I’m sooooo proud of you big brother @princejackson. i know i say it all the f***in’ time but your way with words, the grace, eloquence, and composure is out of this world and always blows me away.

‘You’ve got such a great head on your shoulders and are doing some really f***ing amazing things. you’ve always been my idol and role model and even more so as each day goes on. i love you with all of my heart. happy halloween everyone!! xxo -radagast and gandalf [sic].’
